channel.title: I find it hilarious
channel.description: That, when people release their servers, they feel it necessary to add "I don't give anyone permission to release this anywhere else." Correct me if I'm wrong, what we're working with here [i]IS[/i] stolen "intellectual property" from Jagex, right? I would like to hear the consequences that follow re-releasing a server that someone claims is their own.

item.title: I find it hilarious
item.dc:creator: @S_v2 .S. v2
item.description:
@S_v2 wrote:

Private servers use Jagex’s protocol to communicate with the client, and the protocol is definitely under copyright protection:

All RuneScape code and data, including this message, are copyright 2003 Jagex Ltd. Unauthorised reproduction in any form is strictly prohibited. The RuneScape network protocol is copyright 2003 Jagex Ltd and is protected by international copyright laws. The RuneScape network protocol also incorporates a copy protection mechanism to prevent unauthorised access or use of our servers. Attempting to break, bypass or duplicate this mechanism is an infringement of the Digital Millienium Copyright Act and may lead to prosecution. Decompiling, or reverse-engineering the RuneScape code in any way is strictly prohibited. RuneScape and Jagex are registered trademarks of Jagex Ltd. You should not be reading this message, you have been warned...

(the above message was taken from a RSC client, but I doubt that it doesn’t apply to RS2 too)

Discussing this on MoparScape, however, is a complete waste of time. Most people will repeat what they have heard from others, which tends to be inaccurate. Will you be fucked over for hosting a private server? Maybe. It’s complicated. Don’t ever get too confident. Unless you host your stuff and live in the middle of the ocean in a building surrounded by heavy weaponry.

Read full topic

item.title: I find it hilarious
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:11, topic:502855”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=621080.msg4250110#msg4250110 date=1362287078]

Jagex doesn’t own any rights to any server out there, but the clients and caches are THEIR property.

I thought they have two things in the server that is theirs, but people have re-written to change it.
[/quote]no?

Yes, actually he’s right.

older WinterLove based servers do have two classes that are under Jagex copyright, you also are forgetting the protocol we use.

Those two classes are Stream and Cryption. A server like Hyperion is legal because Graham literally made everything from scratch. Including his own implementation of ISAAC.[/quote]

The isaac cipher isn’t under any copyright protection it is available for free online: http://burtleburtle.net/bob/rand/isaacafa.html
Also just because the server doesn’t use any code from the client doesn’t mean that it doesn’t break the law; the server has to connect to the client through a protocol which depending on the implementation may itself be under copyright protection (however most likely had you went to court with this you would win)

Read full topic

item.title: I find it hilarious
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:10, topic:502855”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=621080.msg4250085#msg4250085 date=1362284760]

Jagex doesn’t own any rights to any server out there, but the clients and caches are THEIR property.

I thought they have two things in the server that is theirs, but people have re-written to change it.
[/quote]no?[/quote]
Yes, actually he’s right.

Jmood:

older WinterLove based servers do have two classes that are under Jagex copyright, you also are forgetting the protocol we use.

Those two classes are Stream and Cryption. A server like Hyperion is legal because Graham literally made everything from scratch. Including his own implementation of ISAAC.

Read full topic

item.title: I find it hilarious
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

I don’t really think anyone cares.

Just because they slap “I don’t give anyone permission to re-release this bla bla bla bla” at the end of their thread doesn’t mean anyone has to acknowledge them. People will do what they want, and if anyone hasn’t figured that out yet, they need to get their head out of their ass.

As for JaGex’s property, I don’t really feel like getting into lawstuff.

Read full topic
